javacsw.services.alarms

Interface IBlockingAlarmAdmin

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    JBlockingAlarmAdmin

    public interface IBlockingAlarmAdmin
    Java blocking admin API for the alarm service.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void acknowledgeAlarm(AlarmKey alarmKey)
      Acknowledges the given alarm, clearing the acknowledged and latched states, if needed.

      Acknowledges the given alarm and resets the latched state, if needed.

      Gets the alarm information from the database for the matching Alarm

    • Method Detail

      • initAlarms

        java.util.List<AscfValidation.Problem> initAlarms(java.io.File inputFile,
                                                  boolean reset)
        Initializes the alarm data in the database using the given file
        Parameters:
        inputFile - the alarm service config file containing info about all the alarms
        reset - if true, delete the current alarms before importing (default: false)
        Returns:
        a list of problems that occurred while validating the config file or ingesting the data into the database

      • getAlarms

        java.util.List<AlarmModel> getAlarms(AlarmKey alarmKey)
        Gets the alarm information from the database for any matching alarms
        Parameters:
        alarmKey - a key that may match multiple alarms (via wildcards, see AlarmKey.apply())
        Returns:
        a sequence of alarm model objects

      • getAlarm

        AlarmModel getAlarm(AlarmKey key)
        Gets the alarm information from the database for the matching Alarm
        Parameters:
        key - the key for the alarm
        Returns:
        an alarm model object

        AlarmState getAlarmState(AlarmKey key)
        Gets the alarm state from the database for the matching Alarm
        Parameters:
        key - the key for the alarm
        Returns:
        an alarm state object

        AlarmModel.CurrentSeverity getSeverity(AlarmKey alarmKey)
        Gets the severity level for the given alarm
        Parameters:
        alarmKey - the key for the alarm
        Returns:
        a severity level result

        void acknowledgeAlarm(AlarmKey alarmKey)
        Acknowledges the given alarm, clearing the acknowledged and latched states, if needed.
        Parameters:

        Sets the activation state of the alarm

        activationState - the activation state

      • getHealth

        AlarmModel.Health getHealth(AlarmKey alarmKey)
        Gets the health of the system, subsystem or component, based on the given alarm key.
        Parameters:
        alarmKey - an AlarmKey matching the set of alarms for a component, subsystem or all subsystems, etc. (Note that each of the AlarmKey fields may be specified as None, which is then converted to a wildcard "*")
        Returns:
        the health value (good, ill, bad)

      • monitorAlarms

        AlarmService.AlarmMonitor monitorAlarms(AlarmKey alarmKey,
                                        akka.actor.ActorRef subscriber,
                                        boolean notifyAll)
        Starts monitoring the health of the system, subsystem or component
        Parameters:
        alarmKey - an AlarmKey matching the set of alarms for a component, subsystem or all subsystems, etc. (Note that each of the AlarmKey fields may be specified as None, which is then converted to a wildcard "*")
        subscriber - an actor that will receive a HealthStatus message whenever the health for the given key changes
        notifyAll - if true, all severity changes are reported (for example, for logging), otherwise only the relevant changes in alarms are reported, for alarms that are not shelved and not out of service, and where the latched severity or calculated health actually changed
        Returns:
        an actorRef for the subscriber actor (kill the actor to stop monitoring)

      • monitorAlarms

        AlarmService.AlarmMonitor monitorAlarms(AlarmKey alarmKey,
                                        IAlarmServiceAdmin.AlarmHandler notifyAlarm,
                                        IAlarmServiceAdmin.HealthHandler notifyHealth,
                                        boolean notifyAll)
        Starts monitoring the health of the system, subsystem or component
        Parameters:
        alarmKey - an AlarmKey matching the set of alarms for a component, subsystem or all subsystems, etc. (Note that each of the AlarmKey fields may be specified as None, which is then converted to a wildcard "*")
        notifyAlarm - a function that will be called with an AlarmStatus object whenever the severity of an alarm changes
        notifyHealth - a function that will be called with a HealthStatus object whenever the total health for key pattern changes
        notifyAll - if true, all severity changes are reported (for example, for logging), otherwise only the relevant changes in alarms are reported, for alarms that are not shelved and not out of service, and where the latched severity or calculated health actually changed
        Returns:
        an actorRef for the subscriber actor (kill the actor to stop monitoring)

      • shutdown

        void shutdown()
        Shuts down the the database server (For use in test cases that started the database themselves)
